content:
• Monday, February 13, 2012
  • LLNW

    More on Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW): Q4 beats despite widening losses on higher expenses as...

    More on Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW): Q4 beats despite widening losses on higher expenses as the software-services company posted higher revenues. Net sales grew 7% Y/Y as the company approaches the tail-end of transforming itself from a pure-play content-delivery network into a provider of software-as-a-service to improve its performance, and the effort is starting to bear fruit. Shares +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCC-OLD

    Calgon Carbon (NYSE:CCC-OLD) falls 3.7% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $138M ($141.8M...

    Calgon Carbon (NYSE:CCC-OLD) falls 3.7% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $138M ($141.8M consensus), and that earnings will be adversely affected by several different issues, including equipment failures during the start-up of new facilities in Europe and Asia. The maker of air and water purifiers expects to report earnings on Feb. 27.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • DMND

    Last week's news (I, II, III) may mark only the beginning of the troubles for Diamond Foods...

    Last week's news (I, II, III) may mark only the beginning of the troubles for Diamond Foods (DMND -6%). Last Wednesday as DMND's board crafted a statement for after the bell, the stock traded far more actively than usual, including aggressive put buying; the following day, shares fell nearly 40%. "This is the definition of insider information," Jon Najarian alleges.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • MAS

    Masco (NYSE:MAS): Q4 EPS of -$0.09 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $1.73B (+2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Masco (NYSE:MAS): Q4 EPS of -$0.09 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $1.73B (+2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • TRTN

    TAL International Group (NYSE:TAL): Q4 EPS of $1.07 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $134.2M (+29%...

    TAL International Group (NYSE:TAL): Q4 EPS of $1.07 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $134.2M (+29% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • HIMX

    More on Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q4 beats across the board on a 20% Y/Y jump in...

    More on Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q4 beats across the board on a 20% Y/Y jump in revenue. Small and medium-sized panel driver sales increased 40.2% Y/Y, representing nearly half of total sales for the quarter. Gross margins rose 360 bps to 22.1% from 18.5%. Shares +9.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • ALNY

    Alnyam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY), which fell after reporting Q4 results last week, is down...

    Alnyam Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALNY), which fell after reporting Q4 results last week, is down 4% AH after filing to sell 7M shares, worth $86.7M based on today's close. The company, less than a month removed from announcing a major restructuring plan, says it will use the proceeds to help advance its drug pipeline, including its ALN-TTR02 and ALN-APC drugs.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • CRL

    Charles River Laboratories (NYSE:CRL): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $291M (+3.3%...

    Charles River Laboratories (NYSE:CRL): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $291M (+3.3% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • RJF

    Raymond James (NYSE:RJF) falls 2.6% AH after Bloomberg reports the company is launching a 10.5M...

    Raymond James (NYSE:RJF) falls 2.6% AH after Bloomberg reports the company is launching a 10.5M share offering, good for proceeds of $366.6M based on today's close. The company plans to use the offering's proceeds to help pay for its acquisition of Morgan Keegan (NYSE:RF).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • LLNW

    Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $46M (+7% Y/Y)...

    Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $46M (+7% Y/Y) beats by $0.6M. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • NSIT

    Insight Enterprises (NASDAQ:NSIT): Q4 EPS of $0.78may not be comparable to consensus of $0.49....

    Insight Enterprises (NASDAQ:NSIT): Q4 EPS of $0.78may not be comparable to consensus of $0.49. Revenue of $1.36B (+1.6% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +14.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • SGEN

    More on Seattle Genetics' Q4: Though results beat estimates, the company is declining to provide...

    More on Seattle Genetics' Q4: Though results beat estimates, the company is declining to provide 2012 guidance for sales of its Adcetris lymphoma drug. Adcetris accounted for over 2/3 of Seattle Genetics' Q4 revenue. SGEN -7.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $169.2M (+19.8%...

    Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $169.2M (+19.8% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +10.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • CUTR

    Cutera (NASDAQ:CUTR): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $18.5M (+21.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cutera (NASDAQ:CUTR): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $18.5M (+21.7% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA): Q4 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.58B...

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA): Q4 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.58B (+17.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) gains 4.2% AH after announcing a $100M deal with DuPont (DD)...

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) gains 4.2% AH after announcing a $100M deal with DuPont (DD) through which Yingli will purchase DuPont's solar metallization pastes and films, and the companies will collaborate on solar technology development. DuPont struck a similar deal with Suntech Power earlier this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • RAX

    Rackspace Hosting (NYSE:RAX): Q4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $283M (+32% Y/Y)...

    Rackspace Hosting (NYSE:RAX): Q4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $283M (+32% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $48.9M (+503% Y/Y)...

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $48.9M (+503% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares -8.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • PETM

    PetSmart (PETM +2.8%) finishes the day higher after Bank of America raises its price target on...

    PetSmart (PETM +2.8%) finishes the day higher after Bank of America raises its price target on the shares to $60 and reaffirms its Buy rating. The bank points to an unexpectedly strong recovery in pet adoptions in the last few months that's driving significant growth in the pet population.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • LPS

    Lender Processing Services (NYSE:LPS): Q4 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $533.8M...

    Lender Processing Services (NYSE:LPS): Q4 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $533.8M (-13.6% Y/Y) beats by $17M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • NTP

    Chinese contract manufacturer Nam Tai Electronics (NTE -12.9%) falls hard after reporting Q4...

    Chinese contract manufacturer Nam Tai Electronics (NTE -12.9%) falls hard after reporting Q4 revenue of $145.3M (-12.7% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.13 ($0.12 profit in year-ago period). Nam Tai's bottom line has been hit by rising labor costs, and it sees labor costs/employee rising another 23% in 2012. The company also warns of continued price pressure in its LCD module assembly business.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • PTE

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL +3.8%) gains after announcing the nationwide launch of Zumba Fitness...

    Majesco Entertainment (COOL +3.8%) gains after announcing the nationwide launch of Zumba Fitness Rush, the latest video game addition to the Zumba Fitness franchise. The game is exclusive on Kinect for the Xbox 360 video game and entertainment system from Microsoft (MSFT +0.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • AES

    UBS starts coverage on AES Corp. (AES +1.9%) with a Buy rating and $15 price target, noting it...

    UBS starts coverage on AES Corp. (AES +1.9%) with a Buy rating and $15 price target, noting it expects the operator of utilities and wholesale power generators to "handsomely outperform its commodity-driven peers in the near term," as recently-appointed CEO Andres Gluski seeks to trim less profitable businesses and aggressively cut costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • LCII

    Drew Industries (DW +8%) hits a new 52-week high despite missing on its Q4 EPS estimates earlier...

    Drew Industries (DW +8%) hits a new 52-week high despite missing on its Q4 EPS estimates earlier today. Revenues beat however, as the company reported a 50% increase in net sales due to a jump in profit from both its RV and manufactured housing segments. Wholesale shipments of travel trailers and fifth-wheel RVs, its primary RV market, increased by 16%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM

  • Crude oil reopens for trade with the March contact dropping nearly all the way back to where it...

    Crude oil reopens for trade with the March contact dropping nearly all the way back to where it was before the technical glitch. March WTI +1.9% at $100.56. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • HRB

    Morgan Stanley's channel checks on H&R Block (HRB -2.2%) indicate the tax season got off to...

    Morgan Stanley's channel checks on H&R Block (HRB -2.2%) indicate the tax season got off to a slow start and the tax preparer's free refund anticipation check hasn't driven much share, causing the investment bank to cut its estimates. HRB has been restructuring its operations, shedding its brokerage unit and winding down its mortgage lending business.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • PCYC

    Shares of Pharmacylics (NASDAQ:PCYC) gain 9.4% and now stand up 71% YTD as traders line it up a...

    Shares of Pharmacylics (NASDAQ:PCYC) gain 9.4% and now stand up 71% YTD as traders line it up a new momo favorite. Boosting sentiment today is an upgrade from TheStreet.com to Buy from Sell, as well as a pesky rumor that Fidelity is buying shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • RRD

    R.R. Donnelley (RRD +2.6%) shares move higher after winning a multi-year multimillion dollar...

    R.R. Donnelley (RRD +2.6%) shares move higher after winning a multi-year multimillion dollar contract to provide a range of production and related services for catalogs and direct mail for Office Depot (NYSE:ODP). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • SIRI

    Barrington Research thinks investor interest in Sirius XM (SIRI -0.2%) will ramp up again as...

    Barrington Research thinks investor interest in Sirius XM (SIRI -0.2%) will ramp up again as management hits financial and operations targets. Analysts keep a Buy rating and a lofty $3 price target firmly in place on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI +0.7%) has been awarded a $95M contract to provide professional, technical, analytical...

    SAIC (SAI +0.7%) has been awarded a $95M contract to provide professional, technical, analytical and executive services to support the Assistant Secretary of Defense for Nuclear, Chemical and Biological Defense.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • CZR

    Caesars (CZR -7%) has been gearing up for legalization of online poker but Barron's says its...

    Caesars (CZR -7%) has been gearing up for legalization of online poker but Barron's says its shares look overpriced because the debt-laden company has little else going for it. Its ~$2B market value assumes legalization of online poker at state and federal levels and significant profits from what is likely to be a very competitive business.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +0.1%) sees a flurry of trading activity after word spreads that bidders are...

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD +0.1%) sees a flurry of trading activity after word spreads that bidders are unimpressed about the firm's go-shop period as the firm prepares to be taken private.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN -2.2%) says the SEC is conducting an informal inquiry and asking that it...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN -2.2%) says the SEC is conducting an informal inquiry and asking that it preserve information related to a $135M donation pledge made to the University of Macau (8-k filing). The SEC's involvement relates to a dispute between WYNN and its biggest shareholder, Kazuo Okada, over the release of records of the donation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • CXM

    Shares of Cardium Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:CXM) peel off 20.1% after the company announces that it...

    Shares of Cardium Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:CXM) peel off 20.1% after the company announces that it will sell over 17M shares of its common stock in a registered direct offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • ABC

    The resignation of the CFO at AmerisourceBergen (ABC -3.2%) prompts at least one analyst to...

    The resignation of the CFO at AmerisourceBergen (ABC -3.2%) prompts at least one analyst to downgrade shares of the pharmaceutical firm. “We weren’t expecting this transition, and it comes on the heels of [ABC’s] first quarterly EPS miss in over four years,” a Robert W. Baird analyst writes, also noting the resignation of ABC's CEO in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -3.2%) shares slide after the company late Friday announced a lawsuit settlement...

    Netflix (NFLX -3.2%) shares slide after the company late Friday announced a lawsuit settlement retroactively applied to its recently announced Q4 results. NFLX new EPS for the quarter is $0.66, it says in a year-end SEC filing; earlier, it had reported earnings of $0.73 on sales of $876M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 7 Comments
  • FTI

    FMC Technologies (FTI +1%) gains on the back of strength in the oil service sector, and despite...

    FMC Technologies (FTI +1%) gains on the back of strength in the oil service sector, and despite being downgraded to Neutral on valuation earlier at Global Hunter. The firm says fierce competition, especially in subsea markets, is likely to pressure the company's margins over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF -1.9%) slips after being downgraded to Below Average on valuation earlier today...

    Lions Gate (LGF -1.9%) slips after being downgraded to Below Average on valuation earlier today at Caris, citing concerns over the company's operating cash flow estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • GWW

    W.W. Grainger (GWW +4.1%) shares sport solid gains after sales jumped 17% Y/Y in January with...

    W.W. Grainger (GWW +4.1%) shares sport solid gains after sales jumped 17% Y/Y in January with help from acquisitions and stronger volume. The supplier of industrial goods ranging from lighting to janitorial products has posted strong results recently, including Q4, as it attracts businesses and institutions looking to consolidate suppliers and reduce inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (JIVE +7.5%) becomes the latest company to get a boost from the Facebook IPO hype...

    Jive Software (JIVE +7.5%) becomes the latest company to get a boost from the Facebook IPO hype cycle, surging after quotes in a weekend Barron's article compared the two companies. That Facebook runs a consumer social networking platform, and Jive provides software for building enterprise social networking sites, seems to have been overlooked. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • OMPI

    Obagi Medical (OMPI +3.6%) trades higher on positive comments out of Cantor this morning. The...

    Obagi Medical (OMPI +3.6%) trades higher on positive comments out of Cantor this morning. The firm says that recent data points from Allergan (AGN +1%) and Estee Lauder (EL -1.4%) support its view that the skin care products manufacturer will beat Q4 EPS estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • PODD

    Insulet (PODD +2.7%), a maker of insulin infusion devices for diabetics, is trading higher...

    Insulet (PODD +2.7%), a maker of insulin infusion devices for diabetics, is trading higher thanks to a bullish note from Barrington. While noting Insulet's recent Q4 report missed estimates, the firm still expects Insulet's OmniPod pump to act as a positive catalyst for shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -5%) gets hit by a downgrade to Hold on valuation at Brigantine, citing...

    First Solar (FSLR -5%) gets hit by a downgrade to Hold on valuation at Brigantine, citing concerns over its 2012 outlook. Solar panel companies are expected to post another quarter of weaker results as a glut of manufacturers in the sector weighs heavily on panel prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMAX

    IMAX, which had 9.8% of its float shorted as of Jan. 31, gains 4.3% after announcing deals with...

    IMAX, which had 9.8% of its float shorted as of Jan. 31, gains 4.3% after announcing deals with Broadway Theater Company to install 4 new digital theater systems in China and Hong Kong, with the first systems set to go live in 2013. IMAX has lofty ambitions for the Chinese market.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • HK

    The CNBC effect: Shares of Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) jump 7.1% after CEO Floyd Wilson hits the...

    The CNBC effect: Shares of Halcon Resources (NYSE:HK) jump 7.1% after CEO Floyd Wilson hits the airwaves earlier today touting the firm's prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • CEO

    Nexen (NXY +2%) catches a lift from upgrade to Market Perform on valuation at BMO Capital,...

    Nexen (NXY +2%) catches a lift from upgrade to Market Perform on valuation at BMO Capital, citing strength in Brent oil prices and the likelihood that the company will name a new CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • IR

    Ingersoll-Rand (IR +2.8%) moves up after Bernstein raises its rating to Outperform, citing...

    Ingersoll-Rand (IR +2.8%) moves up after Bernstein raises its rating to Outperform, citing optimism for a 2013 margin recovery as construction markets begin to stabilize.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • CREE

    Consider this one more similarity between the LED and solar industries: The Chinese government,...

    Consider this one more similarity between the LED and solar industries: The Chinese government, already facing an ITC probe over its support for local solar vendors, is said to be "determined to help" local LED firms weather a difficult 2012. Meanwhile, U.S.-based Cree (CREE -3.2%) is selling off on a downgrade from CLSA, which expect Cree's margins to remain weak down to LED industry price pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU +1.7%) shares move up after Brean Murray reiterates its Buy rating and raises its...

    Baidu (BIDU +1.7%) shares move up after Brean Murray reiterates its Buy rating and raises its price target to $200 from $185, believing the company likely will beat estimates when it reports Q4 results this Thursday. While some areas of advertising have struggled and may continue to do so given China’s slowing economy, the firm sees a lift from continued growth in consumer buying.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • UNFI

    United Natural Foods (UNFI +1.3%) moves up on a BMO upgrade to Outperform on valuation, citing...

    United Natural Foods (UNFI +1.3%) moves up on a BMO upgrade to Outperform on valuation, citing an improving backdrop for margin expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU -1.7%), whose CEO recently passed away in a plane crash, is trading lower following...

    Micron (MU -1.7%), whose CEO recently passed away in a plane crash, is trading lower following sell-side commentary on Friday's Analyst Day meetings (slides - PDF). Deutsche (Hold) expects DRAM industry weakness to continue weighing on shares. However, Oppenheimer (Outperform) is bullish on Micron's NAND flash memory business, and notes its supplier status for EMC's VFCache flash memory modules.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • ROYL

    A number of small-sized oil companies go on a tear after more hostilities with Iran around the...

    A number of small-sized oil companies go on a tear after more hostilities with Iran around the globe keeps traders betting on the best energy plays. After pricing in risk on Big Oil, it's the micro caps in the spotlight today with Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +14.1%), Mexco Energy (MXC +14.8%), and Pyramid Oil (PDO +6.4%) posting big gains - and Blue Dolphin Energy (OTCQX:BDCO) taking the cake with a 66.2% runup.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +10.4%) takes off after S&P ups its rating a notch to B-. The ratings...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +10.4%) takes off after S&P ups its rating a notch to B-. The ratings service points to the liquefied-natural-gas provider's recent deleveraging measures, and improved access to the capital markets as a result of its progress on its LNG export project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -5.5%) is the S&P's leading loser after Brigantine reduces its rating to...

    First Solar (FSLR -5.5%) is the S&P's leading loser after Brigantine reduces its rating to Hold from Buy. Among the reasons cited, the pace of installations in Germany “has slowed dramatically,” with proposals to impose further reductions on feed-in tariffs; and funding delays for the Antelope Valley facility puts its sale at risk, potentially requiring FSLR to buy it back.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • OII

    Oceaneering (OII +1.6%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy with a raised price target of $66 from $57...

    Oceaneering (OII +1.6%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy with a raised price target of $66 from $57 by Goldman Sachs, which cites leverage to rising deepwater drilling and construction activity, as well as enhanced deepwater safety practices. Goldman also says consensus EPS estimates for 2012 and 2013 are too low.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • GNOM

    Complete Genomics (NASDAQ:GNOM) soars, now up over 50%, after saying it's has been selected by...

    Complete Genomics (NASDAQ:GNOM) soars, now up over 50%, after saying it's has been selected by Mayo Clinic's Center for Individualized Medicine to provide outsourced whole human genome sequencing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (ACI -3.7%) dips after Brean Murray cut the shares to Hold, expressing concerns over...

    Arch Coal (ACI -3.7%) dips after Brean Murray cut the shares to Hold, expressing concerns over the company's weak pricing power, and that it may not be able to sell its non-contracted planned 2012 output.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • DMND

    Benefiting from Diamond Foods' (DMND -2.2%) difficulties is John B. Sanfillippo (JBSS +4.4%),...

    Benefiting from Diamond Foods' (DMND -2.2%) difficulties is John B. Sanfillippo (JBSS +4.4%), which should pick up market share from walnut growers no longer wanting to sell their crop to Diamond. Growers had already been chafing under the low prices offered by Diamond and now have an excuse to look elsewhere.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • LF

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF +6.6%) move higher on the strength of positive comments from Imperial...

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF +6.6%) move higher on the strength of positive comments from Imperial Capital and a price target increase from the firm to $8 from $7. Analysts highlight LeapFrog's long-term growth drivers including its innovative pipeline of products and growing database of connected customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -3.5%) shares are downgraded to Sell from Neutral with its price target...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -3.5%) shares are downgraded to Sell from Neutral with its price target cut to $6 from $8 at Citigroup: “As an online recruitment play, MWW faces obvious cyclical risk,” but noting MWW's first Y/Y bookings decline in more than a year, "recent reports by CareerBuilder and LinkedIn suggest to us that MWW’s challenges are likely as much competitive as macro."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +4.3%) rides an upgrade from Morgan Stanley to a long Research Tactical...

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +4.3%) rides an upgrade from Morgan Stanley to a long Research Tactical Idea higher. The carrier has been showing its mettle recently as it has unabashedly raised fees on a myriad of services. CEO Ben Baldanza says the firm wears its reputation for charging fees as a "badge of honor" on the theory that consumers actually only pay for what they use - instead of sharing costs in ticket prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • TXT

    Shares of Textron (TXT +1.2%) are active this morning on rumors that General Dynamics (GD -0.2%)...

    Shares of Textron (TXT +1.2%) are active this morning on rumors that General Dynamics (GD -0.2%) may be willing to pay as much as $38 per share to buy the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • TSL

    Trina Solar (TSL +3.5%) gets a big upgrade from Bank of America, which raises shares to Buy from...

    Trina Solar (TSL +3.5%) gets a big upgrade from Bank of America, which raises shares to Buy from Underperform with a target price raised to $17 from $2. Investors are betting so far today that the upgrade is the right move despite TSL's 44% gain in the past three months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • HSH

    Sara Lee (SLE +1%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform at Bernstein, citing...

    Sara Lee (SLE +1%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform at Bernstein, citing the company's aggressive cost cutting efforts and potential acquisition of North American Meats, plus expectations for improved coffee profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • IP

    Deutsche raises its price target for International Paper (IP +3.1%) to $41 from $39 following...

    Deutsche raises its price target for International Paper (IP +3.1%) to $41 from $39 following the company's announcement of an agreement with the DoJ on Friday for its purchase of Temple-Inland (NYSE:TIN). Deutsche says the deal should to be neutral to FY12 earnings, and adds that it's surprised that IP won't be forced to divest any converting assets.
